intro: Ainsliaea ramosa, commonly known as the clustered ainsliaea, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit, with multiple stems arising from the base. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, with five petals and a distinctive, spurred corona. Ainsliaea ramosa thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests.
